answers.answer: Its best to test when you miss your period & if your periods are irregular, test in about 2 weeks.

This is how I figured I was pregnant! The implantation bleeding and SEVERE fatigue. I also got period like cramps. Like yourself I didnt get periods, havent had one for 4 years lol! I figured I wouldnt be able to fall pregnant due to many complication with kidneys etc so pleasantly surprised when I was! I took cheap tests when I suspected I was but all negative, figured I was testing too early. But my partner was so excited he ran straight out to buy a clear blue digital so I took it the next morning and sure enough there it was, 2-3 weeks. Currently 24 weeks now :) good luck and be patient x
I tested 9 days after my implantation bleeding and I got my positive. try it might show up for u :)

Thanks for the input!  I'm so glad to hear that someone else has gone thru the same thing.  I've always bought the First Response preg test but really wanted to try the ClearBlue with weeks estimator!  Is that the one you used?
Yeah thats the one I used :) good luck & let us know please :)

question: The hubby and I have been TTC for a few months now and this weekend I started having some brown spotting.  It was red for only a day and only a few drops, but it's been happening now for the past 6 days.  It's still not heavy or anything and never shows up on a pad.  I've been EXTREMELY tired this whole week, felt really bloated and moody, felt a little dizzy and nauseous yesterday while I was making dinner, and had lots of headaches.  From what I've read though, it could either be implantation bleeding or just plain old PMS.  The only problem is I have PCOS, hypothyroidism, and diabetes so the last time I had a period was well over six months ago, and that was only because I was on birth control.  Basically, I have no idea when I ovulate or when my period is supposed to come, so I can't base anything on that.  I have taken a few preg. tests, which have all been negative so far.  Is it too soon to test?  Is it just PMS?  Could it be pregnancy?  I don't want to get my hopes up in case it's not...
title: Implantation bleeding?
